intro: Cynoglossospermum oligacanthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its hairy, narrow leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
